thread.title: High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 8
thread.title_full: High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 8 - San Antonio Express-News

author: Terrence Thomas
title: High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 8
text:
Photo: Marvin Pfeiffer /San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 2 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 2 New Braunfels volleyball coach Robin Gerlich talks to her team during their match with Smithson Valley on Oct. 2, 2012.
Photo: Marvin Pfeiffer /San Antonio Express-News New Braunfels volleyball coach Robin Gerlich talks to her team... Image 2 of 2 Jack Zimmerle of Devine breaks free for a long touchdown run against Brackenridge at Alamo Stadium on Sept. 5, 2015.
Photo: Billy Calzada /San Antonio Express-News Jack Zimmerle of Devine breaks free for a long touchdown run... High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 8 1 / 2 Back to Gallery From inside the lines to out, Express-News staff writer Terrence Thomas takes a look back and a look ahead at the high school sports landscape:
Figure this
4: Days until area high school cross country teams begin competing for district championships. The Region IV meet is Oct. 26 in Corpus Christi, and the UIL state meet is Nov. 7 in Round Rock.
97: Combined digs for Southwest libero Brandy Martinez in District 28-6A matches last week against East Central and South San. Martinez had 66 digs in a five-set win over East Central on Sept. 29 and 31 in a five-set loss to South San on Oct. 2.
650: Career wins for New Braunfels volleyball coach Robin Gerlich , who reached the milestone in the Unicorns’ four-set victory over Clemens on Oct. 2. Gerlich has coached at La Vernia, Holmes, Churchill and Seguin, leading Churchill (1998), Seguin (2009) and New Braunfels (2012) to the UIL state tournament and La Vernia to a regional tournament (1989).
Odds and ends
Football: Devine running back Jack Zimmerle was named the Built Ford Tough Class 4A Player of the Week after rushing for a career-high 328 yards and five touchdowns in the Warhorses’ 46-20 win last week over Lytle.
A junior, Zimmerle is the third area player to receive the accolade this season, joining Stevens wide receiver Logan Mann (Week 2) and Kerrville Tivy quarterback Cade Dyal (Week 3).
